1.text: Those sandals might be cute, but they aren’t great for standing.

2.text: If you have a high arch, you might need more support.

3.text: Crossing your arms in front of you can give you poor posture.

4.text: Locking your knees is bad for both your legs and your feet.

5.text: This will help improve the circulation in your legs.
5.vid: /a/a5/Stand for a Long Time Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Compression socks or stockings help circulate the blood in your legs and feet.

7.text: Standing on a hard floor is worse for your body than a squishy mat.

8.text: This can provide some relief to your lower back.

9.text: This is another way to get your blood flowing in your legs.

10.text: If you’re feeling a lot of back pain, give your spine a quick release.

11.text: If your lower back is hurting, stretch it out with a table or countertop.

12.text: Standing all day puts a lot of pressure on your hip area.
